content.description: Bouldery, and punchy little beast. The crux comes right off the deck with a difficult undercling move, but the real, redpoint crux comes just after the fourth bolt with a potent little traverse.
content.location: Starts just right of Candelabra and links into Candelabra at its last bolt.

content.description: Short but steep and stout-looking natural line on the Fire Wall...look for the thin crack slashing across the right side. Might be campusing the lip to finish.
content.protection: Gear to 3", heavier on the small stuff.  Rap anchor.
content.location: Right side of the Fire Wall.

content.description: One of the few warm ups at the lower crags. Two cruxes involve pulling through some roofs, each to a hidden jug, with out-of-sight feet. Sling on the first bolt and long draws on the next few are nice.
content.protection: 5 bolts, lower off biners. Long draws nice.
content.location: Small, semi-separate wall 30' left of the obvious arete that is Candelabra. Follow a path around the left side of the Three Amigos Wall. 1 minute past Zacher Cracker.

content.description: This route ascends the smokey white pillar left of the sheer overhanging face. Steep climbing through some awesome geometric crystalline holds and features, culminating in an airy mantle onto a ledge at the top of the wall. Crux comes just after the 5th bolt moving past a fin-like feature to a good right hand edge/pinch. Like all LOTL routes, this thing is short but sweet.
content.protection: 7 bolts + 2 bolt anchor. Can bridge across and reach the 1st draw from the ground. Belayer should be down in the hole.
